Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: The Federal Communications Commission's Enforcement Bureau proposed a $25,000 fine against Hilton Worldwide Holdings, Inc. for its apparent obstruction of an investigation into whether Hilton engaged in the blocking of consumers' Wi-Fi devices.
Info Source: https://apps.fcc.gov/edocs_public/attachmatch/DOC-336102A1.pdf

Description: The Justice Department reached a settlement with Hilton Worldwide resolving allegation that Hilton it discriminated against a foreign-born worker.  Specifically, the department found that a Hilton-owned hotel in Naples, Florida, discriminated against an asylee by improperly rejecting his Social Security card when the hotel reverified his employment authorization.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/justice-department-settles-lawsuit-against-international-hotel-chain-over-discrimination

Description: Hilton agreed to pay $700,000 as part the settlement of a lawsuit brought by the attorneys general of New York and Vermont in connection with two data security incidents that exposed over 350,000 credit card numbers in 2015.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20190915221132/https://ag.ny.gov/press-release/ag-schneiderman-announces-700000-joint-settlement-hilton-after-data-breach-exposed
https://www.treasury.gov/resource-center/sanctions/OFAC-Enforcement/Documents/04232010.pdf
